docs.lead_paragraph: My older son had colic. Every day at about four in the afternoon he would start to scream, and he would not calm down until eight or nine. We checked for every medical cause, tried every folk remedy, and nothing worked. If you treat colic, our pediatrician quipped, it goes away in about twelve weeks. If you don't, it takes about three months. In other words, there's very little you can do.
docs.abstract: Parents-to-be of either gender might be well served by addressing signs of depression before a baby is born.
docs.snippet: Parents-to-be of either gender might be well served by addressing signs of depression before a baby is born.

docs.lead_paragraph: The new season of “Mad Men,” which begins on Sunday on AMC, stresses the darker side of its era’s innocence, leading viewers to marvel at a world so familiar and so primitive.

headline.seo: Straining to Remain Button-Down in AMC’s Drama
headline.main: ‘Mad Men’ Strains to Stay as Button-Down as Ever
headline.print_headline: Still Straining to Remain As Button-Down as Ever

docs.snippet: The new season of “Mad Men,” which begins on Sunday on AMC, stresses the darker side of its era’s innocence, leading viewers to marvel at a world so familiar and so primitive.

docs.lead_paragraph: Retrospective winks at past ignorance are what makes ''Mad Men'' so funny and, at times, so chilling. ''Mad Men'' mocks and celebrates forbidden vices, the drinking, smoking and promiscuity that in the advertising business of the 1960s flowed heedlessly, without health warnings or the sour taint of political incorrectness. From the start, the show has mined hindsight for wicked humor: a child playing dangerously with a dry-cleaning bag is chided only for messing up the clothes inside; a pastoral family picnic ends with the mom tossing the entire basket of trash onto lush, pristine park grounds; the presidential candidate Richard M. Nixon is marketed as a young, handsome Navy hero.

headline.main: Still Straining to Remain As Button-Down as Ever

docs.snippet: The new season of “Mad Men,” which begins on Sunday on AMC, stresses the darker side of its era’s innocence, leading viewers to marvel at a world so familiar and so primitive.

docs.lead_paragraph: I received an e-mail from a mother who is struggling for words, as so many of us seem to when something tragic happens. We get particularly tongue-tied when a pregnancy goes wrong, because there are no road maps, no rituals, no familiar words.

headline.main: When a Full-Term Pregnancy Ends Tragically

docs.abstract: We often get particularly tongue-tied when a pregnancy goes wrong, because there are no road maps, no rituals, no familiar words.

docs.lead_paragraph: Masha Hamilton's latest novel, 31 Hours, explores what it means to be the parent of a young adult. As I prepare to take my oldest son off to college (more about that next week), the question she raises - in the book and in a guest essay today - is one that has been looping through my brain for months now: after years of protecting our kids, what should we do - and what are we allowed to do - to keep them safe once they are grown?

headline.main: When Is a Parent's Job Complete?

docs.abstract: After years of protecting our kids, what should we do -- and what are we allowed to do -- to keep them safe once they are grown?

docs.lead_paragraph: In his first match since his fourth-round loss at the French Open, Rafael Nadal teamed with Francisco Roig to win at the Rogers Cup.
